SourcedStatement: The Alameda County Registrar is scheduled to send the final ballot for printing on Friday.
Name: Alameda County Registrar
Justification: Relevant authority responsible for the printing and distribution of ballots; providing context on the timeline for the election process.

SourcedStatement: The message was cheered on by several community members and organizations such as the East Oakland Collective nonprofit.
Name: East Oakland Collective nonprofit
Justification: Organization showing support for Love’s campaign; highlighting the campaign’s impact on the community.

SourcedStatement: Love’s lawyers, from the political law firm Kaufman Legal Group, said in their petition that Love had gathered 67 signatures in total and that three of the signatures were unfairly disqualified.
Name: Kaufman Legal Group
Justification: Law firm representing Love; providing context on the petition and the disputed signatures.

SourcedStatement: “While we are disappointed by the court’s decision not to place us on the ballot in November, I remain undeterred in my commitment to serving Oakland and our communities,” she wrote.
Name: Tonya Love
Title: District 7 council candidate and chief of staff for Councilmember Carroll Fife
Justification: Candidate directly affected by the court’s decision; providing her reaction and commitment to the community.

SourcedStatement: My understanding is that there are other candidates for this particular district city council who would’ve liked the opportunity to have more time to gather and submit signatures, and the process needs to be uniform,” he said.
Name: Judge Michael Markman
Title: Alameda County Superior Court Judge
Justification: Authority figure ruling on the case; explaining his reasoning for the decision.

SourcedStatement: In an interview with The Oaklandside last week, Newton was resigned to his failure to gather enough signatures–he picked up 37–but said he would work with whoever came out ahead in the race to help improve the community.
Name: David Newton
Justification: Candidate who also attempted to run for the district seat; providing context on the challenges of gathering signatures and his commitment to the community.

SourcedStatement: Under the Voter’s Choice Act, registered voters on Election Day can cast their ballots at any vote center in Alameda County.
Name: Voter’s Choice Act
Justification: Relevant law governing voting procedures in Alameda County; cited to support Love’s lawyers argument for signature validation.

SourcedStatement: The county attorneys countered in a brief that the state election code deems signatures on a nomination form invalid if they don’t include a signature and a printed name and if the address of the candidate’s supporter is not consistent with their voter registration form.
Name: state election code
Justification: Relevant law governing nomination form requirements; cited by county attorneys to counter Love’s petition.

SourcedStatement: “The protestors said this” statement not found, but community members and organizations such as the East Oakland Collective nonprofit cheered on Love's message.
Name: community members and organizations
Justification: They cheered on Love's message; showing support for her campaign committed to fighting for equity and social justice for their community in District 7.

SourcedStatement: A few other candidates in the last-minute scramble were able to gather enough signatures to qualify for the ballot, among them Ken Houston.
Name: candidates
Justification: Part of the group affected by the last-minute decision by sitting Councilmember Treva Reid not to run for reelection; showing the impact of the decision on prospective candidates.
